author: les mcgregor
comment: Hi. Since upgrading to the latest version of wristmail for wear, where the name changed, I have not been able to forward attachments on my Sony Xperia Z1 compact even after the attachment has been downloaded. When I tap forward, the attachment is not included and has to be manually attached. Can anyone help me here. Thanks.
title: Forwarding of attachments

author: Newthings5
comment: If I try to install the app I get the error code 505. OS: Android 6.0.1 Smartwatch: Moto 360 Sport

reply.author: Dream Code
reply.content: Please uninstall the original k9 first. They cannot co-exist on your phone.

title: Error while installing

author: Daniel Jones
comment: It is fantastic! Good work. However, why it is plain text with no layout in watch? No paragraph at all. I couldn't read my mail like that.
title: Awesome, but why no layout in watch?

comment: Love it.  Based on K9 mail I think, but with wear support.  I also prefer it over stock Android email and I use it on non wear devices too.
title: Great email app

author: Kawaii cat gaming vlogs
comment: Good email for wear but I wish I could compose new emails and have the option to forward emails too from the watch.
title: Good email for wear

author: Christopher Jones
comment: Great app but needs update to reflect k9mail merge to lastest version.

author: Steve Malin
comment: Great app

reply.author: Dream Code
reply.content: The dev of the original K-9 asked us to stop using that name and icon.

author: Mark Meyer
comment: Great app on the phone and on wear.
title: Great App

author: Jim Buchanan
comment: The app works great with 1 exception. If emails could be deleted from the notification screen it would be perfect. For now, you must go into the actual app to delete emails. It is more time consuming to go into the actual app then the notification screen.

reply.author: Dream Code
reply.content: Hello Jim, sorry for the delay. You can enable the delete action into the notification settings. Thanks!

title: Only needs 1 more function for 5 stars

author: Pedro Diaz
comment: Would like to see support for automatic .edu email setups for gmail. Can you make that dream come true will give you 5 stars then.
title: Good app but...

author: Chad Johnson
comment: Great product! Syncs with the watch flawlessly and has lots of great features. The developer is very quick to respond to email and added my feature request right away. Thank you!  -Chad

author: Ahmed Nagy
comment: Support 365 office platform
title: Nice

author: Bonbon Lee
comment: This is the only email client on wear that works with Yahoo mail, but it has some issues. I have 2 accounts added in the app, one Yahoo and one gmail, but when you open the app on wear you can only see one's inbox, you can't switch between them, it seems to be random, or the last one I replied with. I also can't compose emails, I can only reply. If this app gets more polished, you can use multiple accounts on the wear app, and if you can compose a new email, then I would change my rating to a 5.
title: Kind of disappointing considering how great Wear Messenger was...

author: Tony
comment: I was looking for better mail management from my watch - when I saw this from the same author as Wear Messenger with the same keyboards, it was an easy purchase. A request? Would it be possible to customize the Wear notification options? Archive (from Wear) would be big for me. Example: Reply (wear), Reply, Mark Read, Archive, Delete, Spam. That would really make this complete in my book.
title: Great start

author: Michael Good
comment: Nearly perfect- just add a quick delete option within the new mail notifications on the watch and you will have knocked it out of the park.
title: Best email for Android Wear

author: john Piazza
comment: Drags your watch and phone down.

author: Nick Pardo
comment: This is the ONLY option when it comes to checking emails after dismissing the notification on your watch. Excellent developer as well. Only thing it needs is to refresh the mail list when opening the wear app. Having to swipe 8 times to get from the email list to the refresh button and back is kind of a pain, but I'll take what I can get!  Edit: I told you this dev was good!

reply.author: Dream Code
reply.content: You should receive an update in a couple hours featuring what you asked (disabled by default). Enjoy!

title: One of a Kind

author: Mary Sharp
comment: Every time I try to login for my Gmail I get an error so I can't start it on my gear live. Sad it doesn't work.

reply.author: Dream Code
reply.content: You need to enable insecure access. Not really insecure, but they call it that way

title: Paid for it but can't login

author: Minion Mayhem
comment: Keeps saying my credentials are wrong even though I am entering the correct password and email on my note 4
title: Can't login to my email

author: Steven Brady
comment: A great implementation of email on Wear, and built on the solid K9, just can't go wrong!
title: Great!

author: Caleb McCaffery
comment: Great app!

author: Cliff the Crafter
comment: But I wish I could send new emails from my watch instead of just replies.

reply.author: Dream Code
reply.content: Thank you for your feedback, added that to the todo list!

title: Finally showed up on my watch

author: Conrad Sykes
comment: Love it

reply.author: Dream Code
reply.content: Hey! just go into wear settings (see last picture) and choose your keyboard.

author: Deana B
comment: Keeps saying my password is not correct when I know that it is. I tried with other accounts. Can't get it to work :( have to uninstall.
title: Incorrect password

author: Peter Biggs
comment: Would be nice if it all worked.  Very buggy on my Sony SW3.

author: Ken Smith
comment: Can't install.

reply.author: Dream Code
reply.content: Please uninstall the original k9 first. They cannot co-exist on your phone.
